item.title: Switching from attr_encrypted gem to attr_encryptor for better security
item.author: jason@jjasonclark.com (Jason Clark)
item.description: At work we are using the attr_encrypted gem to encrypt some PII on our data before it hits the database. The gem supports using a strong key but this turns out to not be enough. A Github issue was created to address leaking of data caused by using the same initialization vector (IV) and salt for every value. The method used by the attr_encrypted gem to create the IV and salt values is vulnerable. Additionally the IV should also be processed with the CBC-MAC method. The attr_encryptor was created to fix these issues.

item.title: Converting a Sourceforge project to Github
item.author: jason@jjasonclark.com (Jason Clark)
item.description: I was looking for a reason to play with Git more so I thought a good exercise would be to convert an open source project not already using Git. At the same time I put it on Github for easy access.

item.title: Started working with Silverlight
item.author: jason@jjasonclark.com (Jason Clark)
item.description: I started playing with Silverlight 2.0. I learned a lot about the data modeling classes and what is supported. Going to have to spend much more time with Silverlight if I'm going to make anything useful
